intro: Polanisia graveolens var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-veined polanisia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, bluish-green leaves with distinctive purple veins, which give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. The plant is native to Central and South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, spicy scent when the leaves are crushed.
